{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which traction is not used in the lower limb, we need to understand what each traction is used for.

B. Bryant traction is also a type of skeletal traction used for fractures of the femur or tibia in children. 
C. Dunlop traction is a type of skeletal traction used for fractures of the upper limb. 
D. Perkin traction is a type of skin traction used for fractures of the lower limb.
